page.title: 10MRS WATSON AND THE REST
page.content: The current{population}of Doddinghurst and Kelvedon Hatch is 5659. Few of the population have lived here all their lives. Our survey shows that 50% moved here from London, 32% from surrounding districts and 18% from other parts of Britain. 8 of our children have parents who originate from other countries. {Mrs Watson}is one of our oldest and best known citizens. She is now in her 86th year and works 7 days a week in her shop. Mrs Watson moved to the area on her marriage in 1934; she and her husband opened the shop and started a cafe. At that time this was the only building around. The cafe was used particularly by cyclist touring the country side. The cafe closed in 1970 when her son took over the running of the shop, but Mrs Watson still takes a very active part.
